Articles.Content:
In this challenge, you simply must make a vehicle that can preform as many functions as you can. There are no part or weight limitations, so just let your imagination fly. A vehicle must preform at least 3 of the functions in the Scoring section to be considered eligible.

Rules:

1) You may use the Mods listed below if you want, but other then that, no mods.

2) No debug console (including part clipping)

3) It needs to be original (no copying other people's ships)

4) Don't do anything that could be considered cheating (be reasonable )

5) No edited parts

6) You MAY re-fuel your ship whenever you want as long as you do it legit (you can even use things you have previously put up in space for fueling or whatever)

7) Don't exploit glitches

Mods you can use:

Any information mod (Mechjeb, Kerbal Engineer, Protractor, Kerbal Alarm Clock, ect...)

Ferram Aerospace

Procedural Fairings

Any bonus point mods specified below.

Bonus Points:

If you have these mods, you will get bonus points because they apply game mechanics that inhibit you by making the game more realistic.

Deadly Re-entry: +10 Points

TAC Life Support (or any other life support mod): +15 Points

Remote Tech 2: +5 Points

Scoring:

to get a score, rate your ship from 0 to 10 (0 if it is incapable of doing that thing, and 10 if it can do it really well, really fast, and/or really universally) then add up the ratings and the bonus points (if any) for using inhibiting mods for a maximum score of 120. I am not sure, but i think it might be impossible to get the maximum score, so the leader boards will not be filled with 10 guys with scores of 120.

SSTO

Rover

Tanker

Sky Crane

Crew Transfer Vehicle (add 1 for every crew it can carry)

Mun/Minimus Transfer Stage

Interplanetary Transfer Stage

Lander

Rescue Vessel

Other (Specify)

Posting Your Entry:

When posting your entry, make sure to include screenshots of the things you thing are relevant as well as proof (in the form of screenshots, a video, and/or a .craft file) that your ship can do what you say it can in your score. Include your scores in the individual categories and bonuses as well as your final score and a list of mods you used. I made an example of what an entry should look like below, which also is my entry. If you want to go by another name in the Leader Board, put that in the top of the post. Your entry does not need to look exactly like mine, but it needs to have the same info.
